param.name: runtime_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the runtime interface the appliance listens on

param.name: StateId
param.doc: The authentication state identifier UUID

method.name: GET
method.doc: Once a valid authentication state context has been established for a policy that includes the Consent Register Device authentication mechanism, and that mechanism is current for the active state, then the requester may validate the Consent Register Device.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc: No content returned. The request was successful.
Bad Request. There is a problem with the request. The JSON result describes the problem.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.

param.name: mechanism
param.doc: The URI of current authentication mechanism which is interacting with the requester.

param.name: state/stateId
param.doc: If present and length of value is greater than zero, indicates the authentication mechanism is available for subsequent requests. This attribute won't have a value if the HTTP status code is not a 200 family success.

param.name: location
param.doc: If present and length of value is greater than zero, indicates the URL address to send subsequent requests. This attribute won't have a value if the HTTP status code is not a 200 family success.

param.name: message
param.doc: If present and length of value is greater than zero, Error or success message, if any.

param.name: exceptionMsg
param.doc: If present and length of value is greater than zero, indicates details of internally generated exception message. May provide additional information when HTTP result status code is not success.

response.doc: Not Found. The requested service or resource does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.

param.name: Content-Type:application/json
param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.

param.name: mechanism
param.doc: The URI of current authentication mechanism which is interacting with the requester.

param.name: state/stateId
param.doc: If present and length of value is greater than zero, indicates the authentication mechanism is available for subsequent requests. This attribute won't have a value if the HTTP status code is not a 200 family success.

param.name: message
param.doc: If present and length of value is greater than zero, Error or success message, if any.

param.name: exceptionMsg
param.doc: If present and length of value is greater than zero, indicates details of internally generated exception message. May provide additional information when HTTP result status code is not success.

response.doc: An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.

param.doc: Response is in JSON formatting.
